titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of miscellaneous slides of Brooklyn V1991.105
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T16:33-0500

did.unittitle: Collection of miscellaneous slides of Brooklyn
did.container: Film slides by Accession (V1989.2 to V1992.43)

physdesc.extent: ten items housed in one film slides binder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Collection of miscellaneous slides of Brooklyn, V1991.105, Folder number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1991.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for anonymously created items will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Copyright for unpublished works with a known creator are protected until 70 years following the death of the creator. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Collection of miscellaneous slides of Brooklyn contains both black-and-white and color slides depicting various buildings and locations in Brooklyn, dating from circa 1900 to 1980. Exterior and detail views of the Brooklyn Historical Society (formerly the Long Island Historical Society) building are represented in the collection.
